scenarioDescription:
The HD 67087 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 67087 is a star with 1.36 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.55 times its radius. It is located 249.58 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.45 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 67087 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 67087 system


HD 67087 b

HD 67087 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2015-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 67087 b is 973.080 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 67087 b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 67087 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 67087 c

HD 67087 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2015-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.86 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 67087 c is 1542.300 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 67087 c is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 67087 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 67087, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: HD 67087 - System With 2 Exolanets
